tuv.seg: Small claims and a court hearing
Éilimh bheaga agus éisteacht chúirte

If your small claims procedure case could not be resolved and has been referred for a hearing in the District Court, you will receive a letter from the District Court office telling you the date and time of the court hearing and the location of the court itself

Murarbh fhéidir do chás um nós imeachta i leith éileamh beag a réiteach agus gur atreoraíodh é i gcomhair éisteachta sa Chúirt Dúiche, is amhlaidh a gheobhaidh tú litir ó oifig na Cúirte Dúiche ag insint duit dáta agus tráth na héisteachta cúirte agus suíomh na cúirte féin
The case will be heard in public as part of a normal sitting of the District Court
Éistfear go poiblí an cás mar chuid de ghnáthshuí na Cúirte Dúiche
If you have any difficulty with attending court on the date set for the hearing, notify the District Court office and the respondent immediately
Má bhaineann aon deacracht duit le freastal ar an gcúirt ag an dáta a socraíodh don éisteacht, cuir fógra chuig oifig na Cúirte Dúiche agus chuig an bhfreagróir láithreach bonn
You may ask to have the date adjourned, or put back, to another date
Is féidir leat iarraidh ar an gcúirt chun an dáta a chur ar athló, nó a chur ar aghaidh chuig dáta éigin eile
Only the judge can make this order and you will need a very good reason for not being able to attend or go ahead with the case on that date
Is iad an breitheamh amháin ar féidir leo an t-ordú sin a thabhairt agus teastóidh cúis fhíormhaith uait gan bheith in ann freastal ná dul ar aghaidh ar/leis an gcás an dáta úd
If you cannot attend yourself, you can send a representative to make the request to the court on your behalf
Mura féidir leat féin freastal uirthi, is féidir leat ionadaí a chur chuici chun an t-iarratas a dhéanamh os comhair na cúirte ar do shonsa
It is very important to prepare yourself for the court hearing
Tá sé fíorthábhachtach go n-ullmhaíonn tú tú féin don éisteacht chúirte
It may be advisable to get legal advice
B’fhéidir gurbh inmholta é chun comhairle dhlíthiúil a fháil
Under Irish law, a business is required to be legally represented in court-based proceedings
Ní foláir go mbeadh ionadaíocht dhlíthiúil ag gnólacht éigin de réir dhlí na hÉireann in imeachtaí na cúirte
If you are not familiar with the court process, you should familiarise yourself with the layout, court practice and operation of the court in advance of the hearing
Mura bhfuil aithne agat ar an bpróiseas cúirte, ba cheart duit dul i dtaithí ar leagan amach, cleachtadh na cúirte agus feidhmiú na cúirte roimh an éisteacht
You will need to present information to the judge that sets out clearly the nature of your relationship with the respondent, that is, the person you are claiming against
Caithfidh tú faisnéis a thabhairt don bhreitheamh ina leagtar amach go soiléir cineáil do chaidrimh leis an bhfreagróir, is é sin an duine a bhfuil tú ag éileamh ina gcoinne
This relationship could relate to the roles of:
D’fhéadfadh an caidreamh sin bheith bainteach le róil mar:
• Consumer and service provider
• Tomhaltóir agus soláthraí seirbhíse
• Owner of property the respondent has allegedly damaged
• Úinéir na maoine a líomhnaítear go ndearna an freagróir damáiste di
You will need to show what went wrong and give the circumstances surrounding the problem
Caithfidh tú na fabhtanna a léiriú agus na himthosca a thabhairt timpeall na faidhbe
You will need to show how you tried to put the matter right and the steps you took to remedy the situation
Caithfidh tú léargas a thabhairt faoin gcaoi a ndearna tú iarracht cúrsaí a cheartú agus na céimeanna a ghlac tú chun an fhadhb a fhuascailt
You should also know how the various consumer laws protect you in your particular situation and draw the court's attention to them
Ba chóir go mbeadh aithne agat freisin ar an gcaoi ina dtugann na dlíthe tomhaltóirí cosaint duit i do chúinsí faoi leith agus aird na cúirte a tharraingt dóibh
You can read more about consumer rights here
Is féidir leat a thuilleadh a léamh faoi chearta tomhaltóirí anseo
You should be clear about exactly what it is you are claiming for
Ba cheart go mbeifeá soiléir faoin méid beacht a bhfuil tú ag éileamh air
When presenting your information to the court, you should back it up with evidence wherever possible
Ba chóir duit fianaise a thabhairt mar chruthúnas más féidir ar chor ar bith é nuair a chuireann tú d’eolas os comhair na cúirte
• Have your receipt or other proof of purchase ready
• mbeadh d'admháil nó cruthúnas ceannaigh éigin eile réidh leat
• Bring the faulty or damaged goods to the court to show them to the judge
• dtabharfá na hearraí fabhtacha nó damáistithe chun na cúirte lena dtaispeáint don bhreitheamh
• Take photographs of poor workmanship, damaged property or poor quality goods or services that you cannot bring to court
• dtógfá grianghraif den drochshaoirseacht, den mhaoin dhamáistithe nó d'earraí nó seirbhísí droch-chaighdeáin nach féidir leat tabhairt chun na cúirte leat iad
• Get an independent opinion by another expert and have the expert appear in the court as your witness (you will be responsible for any expense this might incur)

• bhfaighfeá tuairim neamhspleách ó shaineolaí éigin eile agus go dtiocfadh an saineolaí os comhair na cúirte mar d’fhinné (is tusa a bheidh freagrach as aon chaiteachas a d’fhéadfadh bheith bainteach leis sin)
• Bring any letters, advertisements or any other documents you may have relied on when buying the goods or services
• dtabharfá litir, fógra nó cáipéis ar bith eile leat a ndeachaigh tú i dtuilleamaí orthu nuair a cheannaigh tú na hearraí nó na seirbhísí
• Ask any other person who can back up your claim, especially in the case of faulty services provided, to attend as a witness
• n-iarrfá ar dhuine ar bith eile ar féidir leo tacú le d’éileamh, go háirithe i gcás seirbhís fabhtacha arna soláthar, chun freastal mar fhinné
You can send them a witness summons if necessary – the Small Claims Registrar can issue a witness summons on your behalf for a small fee
Is féidir leat toghairm finné a sheoladh dóibh más gá – is féidir leis an gCláraitheoir um Éilimh Bheaga toghairm finné a eisiúint ar do shonsa ar tháille bheag
On the day of your court hearing, you will have to attend the District Court
Caithfidh tú freastal ar an gCúirt Dúiche lá d’éisteachta cúirte
It will be a court open to the public and it will be a District Court judge that will hear your case
Is cúirt oscailte don phobal a bheidh inti, agus is breitheamh na Cúirte Dúiche a éistfidh le do chás
When your case is called you will hear your name called out and then the name of the respondent, for example, "Patrick Murphy versus Joe Ryan"
Cloisfidh tú d’ainm á ghlaoch os ard agus ainm an fhreagróra ina dhiaidh nuair a ghairtear do chás, mar shampla, "Patrick Murphy i gcoinne Joe Ryan"
At this point, you should stand up and identify yourself to the court
Ba chóir duit éirí i do sheasamh ag an tráth sin agus tú féin a chur in aithne don chúirt
The Small Claims Registrar will then call out to the judge a summary of what your case is about
Glaofaidh An Cláraitheoir um Éilimh Bheaga achoimre faoina mbaineann le do chás don bhreitheamh ansin
You will be asked to go to the witness box
Iarrfar orthu chun dul isteach i gclár na mionn
You will stand in the witness box and the Court Clerk will assist you to swear an oath or to make an affirmation to tell the truth
Fanfaidh tú i do sheasamh i gclár na mionn agus tabharfaidh Cléireach na Cúirte cúnamh duit chun mionn a ghlacadh nó chun dearbhú a thabhairt chun an fhírinne a insint
The judge will then ask you to begin your case
Iarrfaidh an breitheamh ort ansin chun do chás a thosú
Here is where you must give your side of the dispute, in as clear a fashion as possible and backed up with as much evidence as you need
Is sa tráth sin nach foláir duit do dhearcadh i leith na díospóide a thabhairt, chomh soiléir agus is féidir agus le tacaíocht ón oiread fianaise agus a theastaíonn uait
The judge will ask you some questions, which you should answer as best you can
Cuirfidh an breitheamh roinnt ceisteanna ort, ar chóir duit iad a fhreagairt chomh maith agus arbh fhéidir leat
Remember, the correct way to address the judge is "judge" and you should direct your answers to the judge at all times
Meabhraigh gurb é an beannú ceart do bhreitheamh é “a bhreithimh”, agus go mba chóir duit d’fhreagraí a threorú ar an mbreitheamh i gcónaí
When you have answered the judge's questions, the judge will give the respondent an opportunity to question you
Nuair a bheidh freagra tugtha agat do cheisteanna an bhreithimh, is amhlaidh a thabhairt an breitheamh deis don fhreagróir chun ceisteanna a chur ortsa
Answer these questions as best you can but do not start an argument with the respondent
Freagair na ceisteanna úd ar feadh d’eolais, ach ná cuir tús le hargóint leis an bhfreagróir
After this, you will be allowed to leave the witness box
Ligfear duit clár na mionn a fhágáil dá éis sin
If you wish to call a witness, you should do so at this time
Más mian leat finné a ghlaoch, ba cheart duit é sin a dhéanamh ag an tráth úd
Your witness will go through a similar procedure
Rachaidh d’fhinné trí nós imeachta comhchosúil
When your witness or witnesses have finished, it will be the respondent's turn to give their evidence
Tiocfaidh seal an fhreagróra dá bhfianaise nuair a bheidh d'fhinné nó finnéithe críochnaithe
If your case is against a company, a representative of the company will speak on its behalf
Más i gcoinne comhlachta é do chás, is amhlaidh a labhróidh ionadaí an chomhlachta ar a shonsan
The procedure for the respondent is very much the same as it was for you
Is beagnach mar a chéile é an nós imeachta don fhreagróir agus an nós imeachta duit féin
You will get an opportunity to question the respondent when the judge has finished asking them questions
Gheobhaidh tú deis chun ceisteanna a chur ar an bhfreagróir nuair a bheidh an breitheamh críochnaithe lena gceistiú
You can prepare for this by studying the respondent's reply on the Notice of Dispute (and Counterclaim, if relevant) and by preparing questions in advance
Is féidir leat ullmhú dó sin ach staidéar a dhéanamh ar fhreagra an fhreagróra don Fhógra Díospóide (agus sa Fhrithéileamh más ábhartha é) agus trí cheisteanna a ullmhú roimh ré
You will also need to listen carefully to what the respondent says while in the witness box and you can challenge any evidence you do not agree with at this time

Beidh ort freisin éisteacht go cúramach lena bhfuil le rá ag an bhfreagróir agus iad i gclár na mionn, agus is féidir leat dúshlán a thabhairt in aghaidh fianaise ar bith nach n-aontaíonn léi ag an tráth sin
The respondent will then have an opportunity to call witnesses to give evidence
Beidh deis ag an bhfreagróir ansin chun finnéithe a ghlaoch chun fianaise a thabhairt
You will also be given an opportunity to put questions to these witnesses
Tabharfar deis duit freisin chun ceisteanna a chur ar na finnéithe úd
When all the witnesses have been heard, the judge will usually make their decision there and then
Is iondúil go ndéanfaidh an breitheamh a gcinneadh ar an toirt nuair a bheifear tar éis éisteacht le gach finné
If the judge decides in your favour, they will make an order or decree
Tabharfaidh an breitheamh ordú nó foraithne má thagann siad ar chinneadh i d'fhabhar
This is usually an order for the respondent to pay an amount of money to you, but the judge can decide to make any order they see fit
Is iondúil gurb ordú atá anseo chun is go n-íocfaidh an freagróir suim airgid leat, ach is féidir leis an mbreitheamh cinneadh a dhéanamh chun aon ordú a mheasann siad bheith cuí a thabhairt
For example, the judge may direct that the work be completed or the goods be repaired
Mar shampla, is féidir leis an mbreitheamh treoir a thabhairt go gcríochnaítear an saothar nó go ndeisítear na hearraí
The order will be made to suit your particular case
Ceapfar an t-ordú chun bheith oiriúnach don chás faoi leith agat
If the court makes a decree for an amount of money, the respondent has 28 calendar days to pay you
Má cheapann an chúirt foraithne i gcomhair suim airgid, is amhlaidh a bheidh 28 lá de réir an fhéilire ag an bhfreagróir chun tú a íoc
If the court makes any other type of decree, it will usually put a time limit within which it must be completed
Má cheapann an chúirt cineál foraithne éigin eile, is iondúil go gcuirfear teorainn ama nach foláir di bheith críochnaithe laistigh di
If the judge decides not to uphold your claim, your case will be dismissed
Má chinneann an breitheamh gan seasamh le d’éileamh, is amhlaidh a dhíbhfear do chás
This means that no order or decree will be made in your favour
Ciallaíonn sé sin nach ndéanfar ordú ná foraithne ar bith i d’fhabhar
You can find further information on the District Court hearing on the Courts Service website
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais i leith éisteacht na Cúirte Dúiche ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
